Emily Bache wrote:

> There is just one thing I'm unsure of - this test proves that while one
> thread holds the lock on the record, the other thread can find out that it
> is locked by calling isRecordLocked(). However, the second thread never
> requests the lock, so it's not testing that the second thread blocks in the
> obtainLock() call until the lock becomes available. That was the requirement
> I was trying to test :-)

If it helps, you can decorate your test suite as a JUnitPerf LoadTest to effectively simulate multiple concurrent users.  If any
assertion of the decorated test doesn't hold true under load, then the load test will fail.  This may help validate whether the
locks are being properly acquired and released by multiple threads, without causing a deadlock.

JUnitPerf is available at http://www.clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html.

Mike
